intro: Habenella stenochila, commonly known as the narrow-leaf habenula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Habenella stenochila is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has mild culinary uses in some regions.
